abstract: Strategy of New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio's in helping raise campaign funds for 2014 State Senate elections mirrors similar tactics played out by his predecessor, Michael Bloomberg in 2007; supporters of de Blasio say investigation by state prosecutors and FBI agents risks criminalizing long-accepted ways of conducting politics in state.

headline.print_headline: Mayor’s Elections Strategy  Recalls That of Predecessor
headline.main: De Blasio’s Elections Strategy, Under Scrutiny, Recalls Predecessor’s

snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio’s efforts to channel donations to Democrats in 2014 State Senate races is similar to events that played out in a 2007 race, when Michael R. Bloomberg played a crucial role.
lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio’s efforts to channel donations to Democrats in 2014 State Senate races is similar to events that played out in a 2007 race, when Michael R. Bloomberg played a crucial role.
